description: Sanskrit reading passages organized by difficulty

passages.title: Simple Introduction
passages.sanskrit: अहं रामः अस्मि। अहं छात्रः अस्मि। अहं विद्यालये पठामि। मम पिता शिक्षकः अस्ति। मम माता गृहे वसति।
passages.romanization: ahaṃ rāmaḥ asmi. ahaṃ chātraḥ asmi. ahaṃ vidyālaye paṭhāmi. mama pitā śikṣakaḥ asti. mama mātā gṛhe vasati.
passages.english: I am Rama. I am a student. I study at school. My father is a teacher. My mother lives at home.

passages.title: The Clever Monkey
passages.sanskrit: एकस्मिन् वने एकः वानरः वसति स्म। सः अतीव चतुरः आसीत्। एकदा सिंहः वानरं खादितुम् इच्छति। वानरः वृक्षं आरोहति। सिंहः वृक्षम् आरोढुं न शक्नोति। वानरः सुरक्षितः भवति।
passages.romanization: ekasmin vane ekaḥ vānaraḥ vasati sma. saḥ atīva caturaḥ āsīt. ekadā siṃhaḥ vānaraṃ khāditum icchati. vānaraḥ vṛkṣaṃ ārohati. siṃhaḥ vṛkṣam āroḍhuṃ na śaknoti. vānaraḥ surakṣitaḥ bhavati.
passages.english: In a forest lived a monkey. He was very clever. One day a lion wants to eat the monkey. The monkey climbs a tree. The lion cannot climb the tree. The monkey becomes safe.

comprehension.question: What animal lived in the forest?
How did the monkey save himself?

passages.title: From Hitopadeśa - The Four Friends
passages.sanskrit: मित्रं च मित्रं च सदैव भवेत्। मित्रेण सह सुखदुःखानि भाजयेत्। एकस्मिन् वने चत्वारः मृगाः मित्राणि आसन्। ते सर्वे परस्परं साहाय्यं कुर्वन्ति स्म। व्याघ्रः एकं मृगं हन्तुम् आगच्छति। सर्वे मित्राणि मिलित्वा व्याघ्रं निवारयन्ति। मैत्र्याः बलेन ते सर्वे सुरक्षिताः भवन्ति।
passages.romanization: mitraṃ ca mitraṃ ca sadaiva bhavet. mitreṇa saha sukhaduḥkhāni bhājayet. ekasmin vane catvāraḥ mṛgāḥ mitrāṇi āsan. te sarve parasparaṃ sāhāyyaṃ kurvanti sma. vyāghraḥ ekaṃ mṛgaṃ hantum āgacchati. sarve mitrāṇi militvā vyāghraṃ nivārayanti. maitryāḥ balena te sarve surakṣitāḥ bhavanti.
passages.english: A friend should always be a friend. One should share joys and sorrows with friends. In a forest, four deer were friends. They all used to help each other. A tiger comes to kill one deer. All friends together prevent the tiger. Through the strength of friendship, they all become safe.

comprehension.question: What saved them from the tiger?

passages.title: From Bhagavad Gītā (Chapter 2, Verses 47-48)
passages.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन। मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि॥ योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय। सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते॥
passages.romanization: karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana. mā karmaphalaheturbhūrmā te saṅgo'stvakarmaṇi. yogasthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā dhanañjaya. siddhyasiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṃ yoga ucyate.
passages.english: You have a right to action alone, never to its fruits. Let not the fruits of action be your motive, nor let your attachment be to inaction. Perform actions, O Arjuna, being steadfast in yoga, abandoning attachment, and balanced in success and failure. Evenness of mind is called yoga.

comprehension.question: What is the teaching about action?

passages.title: From Īśopaniṣad (Verses 1-2)
passages.sanskrit: ईशावास्यमिदꣳ सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत्। तेन त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथा मा गृधः कस्यस्विद्धनम्॥ कुर्वन्नेवेह कर्माणि जिजीविषेच्छतꣳ समाः। एवं त्वयि नान्यथेतोऽस्ति न कर्म लिप्यते नरे॥
passages.romanization: īśāvāsyamidaṃ sarvaṃ yatkiñca jagatyāṃ jagat. tena tyaktena bhuñjīthā mā gṛdhaḥ kasyasviddhanam. kurvanneveha karmāṇi jijīviṣecchatṃ samāḥ. evaṃ tvayi nānyatheto'sti na karma lipyate nare.
passages.english: All this, whatsoever moves in this moving world, is pervaded by the Lord. Therefore find your enjoyment in renunciation; do not covet what belongs to others. Performing actions here, one should wish to live a hundred years. Thus, and in no other way, action does not bind a person.

comprehension.question: How can one live without being bound by action?
